heading.title: The Maltese Falcon zażółć gęślą jaźń

synopsis.para: After the death of his partner, private eye Sam Spade is dragged into a quest for a priceless statuette.
Excellent crime melodrama with smart pace and performances. Remade as Satan Met a Lady (1936); and see below.

credits.writer: Maude Fulton, Lucien Hubbard, Brown Holmes from the novel by Dashiell Hammett.
credits.actors: Ricardo Cortez, Bebe Daniels, Dudley Digges, Dwight Frye, Robert Elliott, Thelma Todd, and Oscar Apfel.

reviews.review: "The best mystery thriller of the year." New York Times

synopsis.para: A remake which shows the difference between excellence and brilliance; here every nuance is subtly stressed, and the cast is perfection.

credits.actors: Humphrey Bogart, Mary Astor, Sidney Greenstreet, Elisha Cook Jr., Barton MacLane, Lee Patrick, Peter Lorre, Gladys George, Ward Bond, and Jerome Cowan.

reviews.review: "The first crime melodrama with finish, speed and bang to come along in what seems like ages." Otis Ferguson

"A work of entertainment that is yet so skillfully constructed that after many years and many viewings, it has the same brittle explosiveness - and some of the same surprise - that it had in 1941." Pauline Kael, 1968

synopsis.para: Jewel thieves insinuate themselves into the household of a rich Parisienne, and one falls in love with her.

credits.writer: Samuel Raphaelson, Grover Jones (from play The Honest Finder, by Laszlo Aladar)
credits.actors: Herbert Marshall, Miriam Hopkins, Kay Francis, Edward Everett Horton, Charles Ruggles, C. Aubrey Smith, Robert Greig, and Leonid Kinskey

reviews.review: "One of the gossamer creations of Lubitsch's narrative art...it would be impossible in this brief notice to describe the innumerable touches of wit and narrative skill with which it is unfolded." Alexander Bakshy
"A shimmering, engaging piece of work...in virtually every scene a lively imagination shines forth." New York Times
